content.title: Williams Syndrome Vascular Manifestations
content.description: Vascular abnormalities in Williams syndrome caused by elastin gene deletion

key_concepts.details: Microdeletion at 7q11.23 including the ELN (elastin) gene
Most common vascular manifestation; occurs in 45-75% of patients
Bilateral peripheral pulmonary artery stenosis common
Can affect any artery; renal artery stenosis, coronary, cerebral vessels

content.statement: Williams Syndrome Vascular Manifestations is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Genetic-Disorders that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Williams Syndrome Vascular Manifestations helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Williams Syndrome Vascular Manifestations include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Williams Syndrome Vascular Manifestations.
